text: The 1932-33 Austrian Football Championship was organized by the Vienna Football Association. A single-track II. League served as a substructure to the I. League. These leagues were only open to professional football clubs. First Vienna FC became champion. SV Donau Wien was promoted to the first league for the 1933-34 season. Other federal state associations organized state championships in different modes on an amateur basis. The respective amateur national champions then also played for a champion at the amateur championship. Amateur champion became Grazer AK. ==Final table== Table mode (if points are tied): goal quotient Pl. Name M W D L P 1\. First Vienna FC 22 16 3 3 35 2\. SK Rapid Wien 22 15 2 5 32 3\. SK Admira Wien 22 11 3 8 25 4\. Wiener AC 22 10 3 9 23goal quotient 1,12 5\. FC Wien SC Nicholson changed its name to FC Wien in February 1933. 22 9 5 8 23goal quotient 1,05 6\.
